title: Press Release: Hirono and Collins Propose Bipartisan Bill to Enhance Hate Crime Reporting Standards
text:
Senators Hirono and Collins introduce bipartisan legislation aimed at improving hate crime reporting and response in the U.S.
Quiver AI Summary
Senators Hirono and Collins introduce bipartisan legislation: U.S. Senators Mazie Hirono and Susan Collins have unveiled the Improving Reporting to Prevent Hate Act (IRPHA) to enhance hate crime reporting accuracy. This comes in response to an uptick in such incidents, with many law enforcement agencies failing to report statistics to the FBI.
Legislation aims for actionable data: The IRPHA would hold localities accountable for failing to report hate crime data, requiring them to improve their reporting systems to qualify for federal funding. Supporters argue accurate data is crucial for effective response and community protection against hate crimes.
Community leaders express support: Various advocates, including representatives from organizations like the Anti-Defamation League and the American Jewish Committee, have lauded the legislation, emphasizing the necessity of comprehensive reporting to combat bias-motivated violence.
